pages.text: And if We show them mercy and free them of the distress they have, they would still blindly continue with their transgressions
And We did certainly punish them, but they did not become humble towards their Lord, nor do they submit
Until when We open upon them a door to severe punishment, they are despaired
And He it is Who gave you the ears and the eyes and the minds. You thank but little
And He it is Who multiplied you on the earth, and to Him you shall be gathered
And He it is Who gives life and causes death. And alternation of the night and the day is His handiwork. Do you not then understand
But they say the like of what the earlier peoples said
They say, "Are we certain to be raised again to life when we are dead and become dust and bones
This promise given to us now was also certainly given to our forefathers. These are nothing but stories of the ancients
Ask, "Whose — if you know — is the earth, and whose is whatever therein
They will say, "Allah's." Ask, "Why do you not remember [and worship Him alone] then
Ask, "Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the mighty Throne
They will say, "Allah's." Ask, "Will you not then take heed of Him
Ask, "Who is it in Whose hand is the absolute control of all things and Who shelters, but Who needs none to shelter Him, if you do but know
They will say, "Allah." Ask, "How then are you deluded into worshipping someone/thing other than Him
